item.description:
@danmazmanzcool wrote:

Okay Credits to me danmanzcool1 for making this tut and credits for Radeon for the know how.
rep is welcome
Okay what it basicly does is edit the getcodebase to what the world we would want it to be so first lets import some methods.
So create a new document I called mine bot.java. ( yes I know original :roll: )

import java.applet.*;
import java.net.*;
import javax.swing.*;
import java.util.*;
import java.awt.event.*;
import java.awt.*;
import java.util.Hashtable;

Lets say what our class implements

public class Bot implements AppletStub, ActionListener {
public static client rs = null; //finds client.java
public String server = null; // the server string as in po4...
public static String host = "po4";// the string host
private static Properties params = new Properties(); // some params for lowmen..
public static JFrame mainframe;// soime GUI
public static JPanel gamePanel; //loading the runescape in the gui
public static String title = "your title";]// the title of ur gui

add this after it

public String getParameter(String key) { System.out.println(key); return params.getProperty(key); } That prints out and gets the properties of lowmen…

add this after wards

public boolean isActive() {
        return false;
    }

overides some methods in the runescape source code.

Okay now lets get cracking with overiding the source code with our world codes.
add this

public URL getCodeBase()
    {
        try{
            return new URL("http://" + Bot.host + ".runescape.com");

        catch(Exception e){
            return null;
        }
    }

    public URL getDocumentBase()
    {
        return getCodeBase();
    }
    
    public AppletContext getAppletContext() {
        return null;
    }

Now lets add our servers

Okay now lets our applet size

public void appletResize(int width, int height){}

Now lets add our Gui, params and info

public static void main(String args[])
    {
    params.setProperty("worldid", "4");
    params.setProperty("modewhere", "0");
    params.setProperty("modewhat", "0");
    params.setProperty("lang", "0");
    params.setProperty("lowmem", "1");
    new Bot(args);
    }
    
     public Bot(String args[])
    {
    changeServer();
            rs = new client();
            rs.setStub(this);
            rs.init();
            this.rs = rs;
     try{
            mainframe = new JFrame(title);
            mainframe.setResizable(false);
            gamePanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
            gamePanel.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(765, 503));
            gamePanel.add(rs);
            //BuildMenus();
            mainframe.getContentPane().add(gamePanel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
            mainframe.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
            mainframe.pack();
            mainframe.setVisible(true);
            }
        catch(Exception e){
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
            info();
    }
  
    public void info()
    {
    System.out.println("Loaded.
The Bot is Set to Unsigned Applet, Removing the UID Check.");
    }
    public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent d)
    {
        if (d != null)
        {
        	if(d.getActionCommand().equals("Exit")) 
        	{
        		System.exit(0);
        	} 
        	else if(d.getActionCommand().equals("Change Server")) 
        	{
        		changeServer();
        	} 
        }
    }
    
    public static client getClient()
    {
        return rs;
    }
}

[br][size=1]Posted at: August 18, 2006, 04:57:53 PM[/size][hr]Yay we did it now compile and it should be errorless.

here is the full code

[code]import java.applet.;
import java.net.;
import javax.swing.;
import java.util.;
import java.awt.event.;
import java.awt.;
import java.util.Hashtable;

public class Bot implements AppletStub, ActionListener {

public static client rs = null;
public String server = null;
public static String host = “po4”;
private static Properties params = new Properties();
public static JFrame mainframe;
public static JPanel gamePanel;
public static String title = “Example not to be used”;

// private static final int MENU_ITEM_PLAIN = 0;
//private static final int MENU_ITEM_CHECK = 1;
//private static final int MENU_ITEM_RADIO = 2;
public String getParameter(String key)
{
System.out.println(key);
return params.getProperty(key);
}

public boolean isActive() {
return false;
}

 public URL getCodeBase()
{
    try{
        return new URL("http://" + Bot.host + ".runescape.com");
    }
    catch(Exception e){
        return null;
    }
}

public URL getDocumentBase()
{
    return getCodeBase();
}

public AppletContext getAppletContext() {
    return null;
}

public void changeServer()
{
String server = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("Enter a World number");
System.out.println("Set Server to: " + server);

{
Bot.host = “ul7”;

public void appletResize(int width, int height){}

public static void main(String args[])
{
params.setProperty("worldid", "4");
params.setProperty("modewhere", "0");
params.setProperty("modewhat", "0");
params.setProperty("lang", "0");
params.setProperty("lowmem", "1");
new Bot(args);
}

 public Bot(String args[])
{
changeServer();
        rs = new client();
        rs.setStub(this);
        rs.init();
        this.rs = rs;
 try{
        mainframe = new JFrame(title);
        mainframe.setResizable(false);
        gamePanel = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
        gamePanel.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(765, 503));
        gamePanel.add(rs);
        //BuildMenus();
        mainframe.getContentPane().add(gamePanel, BorderLayout.CENTER);
        mainframe.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        mainframe.pack();
        mainframe.setVisible(true);
        }
    catch(Exception e){
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
        info();
}

public void info()
{
System.out.println("Loaded.

The Bot is Set to Unsigned Applet, Removing the UID Check.");
}
public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent d)
{
if (d != null)
{
if(d.getActionCommand().equals(“Exit”))
{
System.exit(0);
}
else if(d.getActionCommand().equals(“Change Server”))
{
changeServer();
}
}
}

public static client getClient()

{
    return rs;
}

}[/code]

Okay so now we compiled we need to make run.bat open up a text document and in it add

@echo off
java -cp ./runescape.jar;. Bot
pause

then save it as run.bat

Now run. HOLY SHIT we get an error. I bet now ur thinking dam i wasted all this time.
well it’s simple the reason it’s not running is it can’t find runescape.jar.
So lets download runescape.jar from www.po4.runecape.com/runescape.jar

Kool but now lets create an autoupdater.

import java.net.*;
import java.io.*;

public class autoupdater
{


private void begin()
{
get("www.po4.runescape.com/runescape.jar");
}
 public void get(String url)
    {

        try{

            URLConnection connection = new URL(url).openConnection();
            String f[] = url.split("/");
            File file = new File(f[f.length - 1]);
            int length = connection.getContentLength();
            System.out.println("Downloading " + file + " (" + connection.getContentType() + ", Size:" + length + " bytes)");
            InputStream instream = connection.getInputStream();
            FileOutputStream outstream = new FileOutputStream(file);
            int size = 0, copy = 0;
            while((copy = instream.read()) != -1){

                outstream.write(copy);
                size++;
            }
            if(length != size){

                System.err.println("Error: " + file + " corrupted in transfer.");
                instream.close();
                outstream.close();
            }
            else{

                System.out.println("Successfully loaded " + file + " Size:" + size + " bytes.");
                instream.close();
                outstream.close();
            }
        }
        catch(Exception e){

            System.err.println("Error connecting to " + url);
        }
    }
    public static void main(String args[])
    {

        new autoupdater().begin();
    }
    }

There it is, to run the updater make a new file called updater.bat and in it add

java autoupdater
pause

and there we have it run it from straight from the runescape.jar and every time u want to update just double click updater

THANKYOU the end but now
rep is welcome

item.source: Making an autoupdating client without deobbing or byte code
